full_translation:
**Lü Dongbin the Pure Yang Perfected’s Alchemical Formulas**

**Heavenly Treasure Dragon Sprout (Red Water Parsley)**
Foremost among herbs, it stands supreme,
Turning the false to true—where green appears.
It subdues the Five Metals and Eight Stones,
And softens stubborn copper like silk.

**Treasure Sand Dragon Sprout (Mulberry Leaf)**
Green leaves, white blossoms in wild fields grow,
First planted by farmers long ago.
Though mortals know not this immortal fruit,
It too can soften copper like silk.

**Jointed Dragon Sprout (Motherwort)**
Green leaves, white blossoms stretch o’er fields,
Refined to frost, its power revealed.
It subdues the Five Metals and Eight Stones,
And crows that feed on it live long.

**Sweet Pear Dragon Sprout (Wild Pear)**
Unplanted, unsown on lofty slopes,
When ripe, steep in vinegar—do not scorn.
It fixes mercury into solid form,
And alchemists refine it with care.

**Dual Qi Dragon Sprout (Mountain Asarum)**
Water and fire forge it into sand,
Behind the mountain’s back, I dwell.
Sulfur and mercury yield treasured gold,
And alchemists who grasp it find jade flawless.

**Five Phoenix Dragon Sprout (Solomon’s Seal)**
Five phoenixes thrive in mountain streams,
Tall and proud in clustered beams.
Gather at mid-autumn in the fifth month,
Like phoenix wings in flight.

**Heavenly Blade Dragon Sprout (Sweet Flag)**
At birth, it resembles a sword’s form,
White roots spread, leaves lush and green.
Harvest in the fourth month’s midst,
A touch of realgar outshines gold.

**Earth Brocade Dragon Sprout (Spotted Ardisia)**
Red blossoms deep in mountain glens,
Leaves round and crimson like coins.
It subdues realgar into medicine,
Prolonging life when consumed.

**Brocade Spark Dragon Sprout (Teasel Root)**
Mortals dismiss it with careless hands,
Yet heaven’s way includes it in formulas.
It refines saltpeter for alchemical use,
Turning copper to treasure most fine.

**Sweet Dew Dragon Sprout (Licorice)**
A single stem with leaves most potent,
Named "State Elder" by the Yellow Emperor.
Its roots and shoots refine great medicine,
Subduing *pi* into frost-like silver.

**Golden Beauty Dragon Sprout (Dock Root)**
Red roots, purple leaves like three-edged blades,
Thriving by rivers in summer’s heat.
Gather its leaves in midwinter’s time,
Powdered frost fixes copper and silver.

**Seeking Crow Dragon Sprout (Cherry)**
Like dragons clinging to cliffside trees,
Leaves resemble young boar’s first growth.
Dry the largest for potent medicine,
Borax transforms it to jade’s sheen.

**Golden Thread Dragon Sprout (Dodder)**
Golden threads drape from branch tips,
Harvest in the seventh month, simmer in water.
It subdues sulfur into wondrous treasure,
And those who consume it soar like birds.

**Carefree Dragon Sprout (Daylily)**
A common herb called "Carefree,"
Growing by fences, on terraces high.
Mortals know not the immortal’s art,
Yet it nurtures Penglai’s isles for ages.

**Fractured Flame Dragon Sprout (Houseleek)**
Planted in pots and small courtyards,
The wise know its true alchemical worth.
It refines cinnabar and white copper,
Curing coughs in an instant.

**White Snow Dragon Sprout (Poppy)**
Blossoms like snow, leaves like indigo,
Subduing realgar’s stubborn nature.
Immortals seek this wild grass,
Consuming it to ascend to grotto-heavens.

**Unfeeling Dragon Sprout (Pinellia)**
Curled leaves, round and long,
New sprouts emerge in due season.
Three leaves refine great medicine,
Subduing *danyang* into silver sand.

**Golden Thread Dragon Sprout (Dodder)**
Beyond wild fields, simmered to gold,
Only the discerning know its noble nature.
It fixes mercury, making it stable,
Most prized in the immortal’s canon.

**Deer Antler Dragon Sprout (Indigo)**
Planted on land, it thrives,
Year-round leaves grow lush and full.
Refined to frost by proper method,
It subdues cinnabar’s *pi*.

**Jade Vessel Dragon Sprout (Radish)**
Round roots, large heads like jade vases,
Meeting cinnabar, it works naturally.
Wrap cinnabar in its hollowed root—
This sacred art yields perfection.

**Jade Essence Dragon Sprout (Willow Catkins)**
Late spring’s third month, far from embankments,
Near pavilions, they drift everywhere.
Gather and refine by proper method,
Immortal’s praise it as a boon.

**Hanging Bean Dragon Sprout (Honey Locust)**
Like swords or blades suspended in air,
Alchemists know its great merit.
It subdues cinnabar, resisting fire,
Turning stubborn copper to treasure.

**Golden Essence Dragon Sprout (Spurge)**
Golden leaves sprout fresh by trees,
Roots stretch to yellow springs, ageless.
In spring’s second month, its sap turns black,
Harvest to fix mercury in the workshop.

**Five-Leaf Dragon Sprout (Purslane)**
Red skin, black seeds, leaves verdant,
White stems, yellow blossoms—five directions aligned.
Refining cinnabar into golden hue,
Nurturing life in the cinnabar field.

**Floating Water Dragon Sprout (Duckweed)**
Rootless, on water like green coins,
Tender round leaves in fifth-month ponds.
Dried, it refines great medicine,
Subduing cinnabar to perfection.

**Crown-Piercing Dragon Sprout (Pipewort)**
Snow-like in barren fields, unplanted,
Clustered like lotuses in pools.
The wise treasure it as rare gem,
A touch of cinnabar turns it swan-white.

**Earth Bone Dragon Sprout (Goji Berry)**
Berries like cinnabar, leaves like clouds,
Winter roots, spring-summer blooms.
Harvest in autumn’s red maiden,
Refining cinnabar to silver’s gleam.

**Earth Nail Dragon Sprout (Plantain Seed)**
Long leaves without roots, a single stem,
Its dwelling suits it alone.
It subdues mercury into supreme treasure,
Alchemists wield its divine power.

**Wood Ear Dragon Sprout (Mullein)**
Growing on wood like ears,
Unrecognized by mortals, yet potent.
It transforms the Eight Stones to medicine,
A touch of realgar turns it gold.

**Earth Tray Dragon Sprout (Lotus Leaf)**
Powdered frost transmutes to silver,
Round on water, verdant hue.
Though common folk pass it by,
It subdues *pi* frost with great efficacy.

**Ten-Thousand-Fathom Dragon Sprout (Usnea)**
Countless strands, ten thousand fathoms long,
Draped on lofty pines, blossoms pale and deep.
It subdues cinnabar to great medicine,
Transforming crows and chickens to phoenixes.

**Purple Blossom Dragon Sprout (Thistle)**
Purple blooms, green stems stretch o’er barren fields,
Roots and leaves gathered whole, their age unknown.
Harvested in mid-summer, dried in sun’s fierce gaze,
It subdues *pi* mercury, never to return.

**Fragrant Wood Dragon Sprout (Aloeswood)**
Deep gardens, secluded courts bear ever-springing boughs,
Roots and leaves best gathered in early summer’s grace.
It tames *pi* frost to pure white snow,
Turning copper to iron—beyond mortal thought.

**Golden Medicine Dragon Sprout (Chrysanthemum)**
Wondrous roots, stalks bloom with flowers rare,
Till the Double Ninth unfurls its finest blooms.
It subdues sulfur to treasure bright,
Consumed, it banishes illness, roots and all.

**Black Ascension Dragon Sprout (Indigo)**
High peaks, steep ridges nurture its verdant shoots,
Only the wise know its lofty branches’ worth.
It tames cinnabar to mirror-like sheen,
Its embryonic hue unchanging, flawless.

**Round-Leaf Dragon Sprout (Epimedium)**
Round, delicate leaves carpet verdant hills,
Summer’s heat dries them for alchemical use.
It binds realgar to golden hue,
Ninefold refined, it forges the Great Elixir.

**Fragrant Root Dragon Sprout (Cyperus)**
Roots called "green attachment," fragrant and fine,
By brooks and streams, its abundance grows.
Trust it to subdue *pi* into liquid gold,
Consumed, it transforms life into immortal streams.

**Mercury Sand Dragon Sprout (Jack-in-the-Pulpit)**
Spikes like onion blooms, first flushed with red,
Roots and leaves gathered for their potent might.
It subdues realgar to mighty medicine,
Transmuting dead iron to stubborn bronze.

**Strange Blossom Dragon Sprout (Peony)**
Late spring, near Grain Rain, buds unfold,
Flowers and leaves plucked with roots as one.
Powdered frost melts to silver’s flow—
No fear of error in its wondrous touch.

**Dragon Treasure Dragon Sprout (Tree Peony)**
With Grain Rain’s arrival, crimson buds swell,
Mixed hues dazzle, peerless in splendor.
It refines powdered frost to radiant light,
Those who master it ascend to immortals’ halls.

**Evergreen Dragon Sprout (Pine)**
On perilous peaks, its branches rise,
Leaves like green phoenix tails align.
It subdues mercury for transmutation’s art,
Through ages unending, sages’ wisdom shines.

**Side-Facing Dragon Sprout (Sumac)**
Yin Mountain’s streams bear myriad blooms,
Amid ten thousand leaves, its fame endures.
Evergreen, its heart bears fruit,
It tames *pi* frost to gleaming silver.

**Golden Blossom Dragon Sprout (Mallow)**
Spring’s warmth nurtures its fragrant growth,
As stems lengthen, golden blooms appear.
Its alchemical work grants divine power,
A treasure cherished in immortals’ abodes.

**Purple Gold Dragon Sprout (Camphor)**
Purple roots, white leaves by trees take root,
The enlightened prepare it for sacred arts.
It restrains the volatile, anchors metal and stone,
A touch of sulfur and it yields in submission.

**Earth Gall Dragon Sprout (Dodder)**
Purple flowers, green leaves thrive in fields,
It subdues arsenic powder, merging with sulfur’s spirit.

**Tie-Silk Dragon Sprout (Goat’s Horn Herb)**

**Disputing Earth Dragon Sprout (Single-Stemmed Grass)**

**Dao-Generated Dragon Sprout (Ground Bamboo)**
Unplanted, unsown, it grows of itself,
By dwellings and pavilions it leans.
It binds sun and moon to forge the great elixir,
Subduing cinnabar with singular potency.

**Immortal’s Robe Dragon Sprout (Usnea)**
High-hung usnea sways in length,
Gathered by hermits from deep mountains.
It tames volatile essences, stills metal and stone,
Mercury yields, dead sulfur obeys.

**Crimson Claw Dragon Sprout (Spinach)**
It endures fierce heat, defies bitter frost,
Yet falls to the ravages of wanton winds.
*Pi* frost subdued, it gleams like jade,
Immortals gather it for the alchemical chamber.

**Immortal’s Palm Dragon Sprout (Reedmace / Golden Hook / Wild Jujube)**
By cold pools, near cave mouths it thrives,
In early summer, lush and rich, it yields its frost.
Sulfur bound, none comprehend its power—
Consumed, it darkens hair, restores youth’s hue.

**Silver-Hair Dragon Sprout (Scallion)**
Roots like garlic, leaves like locks,
A touch of *pi* and it ceases to fly.
Mortals know not this immortal’s drug,
It masters *pi* frost, stills powdered arsenic.

**Immortal’s Strength Dragon Sprout (Chinese Leek)**
It subdues cinnabar, silvery as refined silver,
Refining immortal bones for noble encounters.
I urge you: speak not of it to others,
Its leaves alone heal the emaciated.

**Longevity Dragon Sprout (Wintergreen)**
Through four seasons, though grasses bloom,
By green pools its tender shoots endure.
Sulfur bound, it gleams like true jade,
Transmuting copper, softening iron—worthy of praise.

**Three-Yellow Dragon Sprout (Rehmannia)**
By streams and wildlands it stands,
Its three yellows discerned, its wonders divine.
Sulfur bound, its essence preserved,
Fire repelled, its medicinal power awakens.

**Tree-Entwining Dragon Sprout (Chinese Trumpet Creeper)**
Dragon sprouts with ancient roots,
Far-reaching vines cling to trees, summer’s gift.
Gathered in the seventh month, a treasure,
A touch of mercury essence turns it to silver.

**House-Born Dragon Sprout (Moss on Roof Tiles)**
Neither earth nor mountain its home,
It grows on rooftops, among tiles.
Alchemists gather it for the crucible—
A touch of mercury and it dries naturally.

**Frost-Enduring Dragon Sprout (Selfheal)**
Dense leaves, jointed stems, purple-white blooms,
Spring’s vigor fades by summer’s end.
Its juice, divinely wrought, holds wondrous power,
A touch of mercury essence turns it to dry sand.

**Mulberry-Laugh Dragon Sprout (Mulberry Leaves and Twigs)**
Early spring’s prunings burned to ash,
Its lye boiled to frost, the base prepared.
Sulfur’s great passage ignites crimson flames—
A touch, and mercury bows, ceasing to fly.

**Central Dragon Sprout (Yellow Grass)**
Dragon sprouts ground to powder, mulberry’s query,
In a sweet crucible, red-hot, it is wrapped.
Buried in earth, blackened and refined,
Mercury seethes, yet ceases to flee.

**Mysterious Orb Dragon Sprout (Eggplant)**
Amidst blossoms, it forms like a sphere,
Sulfur bound, its depths profound.
Transmuting stubborn copper to snow-white,
Eternal, beyond the common stream.

**Incense Burner Dragon Sprout (Perilla)**
Yellow blooms, green leaves by ponds,
It subdues sulfur, stills the eight stones.
Immortals left this method behind—
Mortals scarcely grasp its swift cure.

**Green Dragon Dragon Sprout (Kudzu Vine)**
Spring-born, vines stretch like dragon heads,
Winding, coiling, roaming far.
It resolves the eight stones into the great elixir,
And naturally thickens mercury’s flow.

**Earth Ginseng Dragon Sprout (Anemarrhena)**
Anemarrhena, fritillaria, and jack-in-the-pulpit,
Pounded to powder, mixed with vinegar.
The herbal mother forms pellets in the golden crucible—
Three pounds of fire refine them into silver.

**Purple-Backed Dragon Sprout (Oil-Spot Leaf)**
Hops’ purple leaves, rare among men,
Plum’s slender blooms, speckled leaves.
Cinnabar meets it and dies,
Mercury subdued, it withers dry.

**Heavenly Flame Dragon Sprout (Lotus)**
Root and leaf abide in water,
Blossoms like flames, leaves crimson beneath.
Gathered in the sixth month for offerings,
It too can bind mercury, turning it to silver.

**Preserving Nature Song**
When burning dragon sprouts to temper their smoke,
Smoke gone, essence firm, its power endures.
Five pounds of slow fire are hard to control—
Yet the immortals’ method is no mystery.

**Discerning the True**
Gather dragon sprouts in their season,
True and lawful, they never fail.
Root, leaf, stem, fruit—each has its use,
Misused, danger and error arise.

**The Verdant**
Seventy-two kinds of dragon-sprout herbs,
Timely gathered, they become a household treasure.
They turn the false to true,
Heaven grants robes and sustenance to the poor Daoist.

**The Alchemical Refinements of Pure Yang Lü True Man—Concluded.**

chunks.original_text: 纯阳吕真人药石制 天宝龙芽　赤芹 草中第一最为先，点假成真遇有绿。 伏制五金并八石，会点顽铜软似绵。 宝砂龙芽　桑叶 青叶白华在野田，农人栽种也为先。 凡流不解神仙果，亦点顽铜软似绵。 对节龙芽　益母 青叶白华长野田，烧炼成霜大有贤。 伏制五金并八石，鸦餐尚自得延年。 味棠龙芽　杜梨儿 不栽不种在高坡，成时米醋莫轻他。 伏制水银成顽定，卫人用意自消磨。 二气龙芽　山荷叶 水火造化结成砂，水山背后我出家。 硫黄水银伏成宝，卫人会得玉无瑕。 五凤龙芽　管仲 五凤多生探涧中，意生高长一丛丛。 只在五月中秋采，恰似凤凰翅尾同。 天刃龙芽　莒蒲 初生时与剑伺形，根白遍地叶青浓。 但於四月中问采，雄黄一点胜金容。 地锦龙芽　衣斑 红华长深山，叶赤圆似钱。 伏制雄为药，服之得延年。 锦铄龙芽　续断 凡流仗艺轻轻手，岂料神天入药方。 能制焰硝为宝用，点铜成宝最为良。 甘露龙芽　甘草 独科几叶最神通，黄帝封为国老名。 采得根苗为大药，伏毗如霜就如银。 金美龙芽　羊蹄 根红叶紫似三棱，正湿临津夏便成。 只候仲冬收取叶，粉霜伏住点铜银。 觅乌龙芽　樱桃 如龙树挂脸崖遮，叶似初生猛麓村。 采取害乾大者药，硼砂点就玉琼莹。 金丝龙芽　兔丝 状如金线挂枝梢，七月收之用水熬。 伏住硫黄成妙宝，人服百日胜飞遥。 无忧龙芽　置草 一般草药号无忧，宅中栏槛长台头。 凡流不识神仙法，抚字蓬莱逐几秋。 碎焰龙芽　护宅 盆池小院种偏多，智者如真理若何。 能制炮砂白铜炼，人服咳嗽立消磨。 白雪龙芽　秃疮花 华如白雪叶如蓝，伏制雄黄本性坚。 神仙每欲思荒草，服饵飞升入洞天。 无心龙芽　半夏 卷叶偏宜长叶圆，义宾分便长新芽。 三叶堪与成大药，丹阳伏住化银砂。 金丝龙芽　兔丝 野田净外熬金色，识者方知品性高。 能制水银发便定，神仙部内最偏饶。 鹿茸龙芽　蓝草 陆地种偏宜，经年长叶肥。 作霜依法用，伏住朱砂毗。 玉瓶龙芽　萝卜 头大根圆似玉瓶，朱砂逢遇自然能。 取根作窍朱砂裹，此圣神妙自得成。 玉英龙芽　柳絮 末春三月远华堤，近傍亭台处处飞。 收取正伏方制法，神仙夸好得便宜。 悬豆龙芽　皂角 如刀似剑挂悬空，术士知之有大功。 能伏炮砂令拒火，功成便点硬顽铜。 金精龙芽　大戟 金叶初生倚树鲜，根长黄泉不记年。 二月仲春神黑足，采时汞伏舍中安。 五叶龙芽　马齿 皮红子黑叶青春，骨白华黄按五方。 丹砂制伏成金色，丹田养命寿延长。 水浮龙芽　浮萍 无根水上长青钱，五月池塘嫩叶圆。 采得害乾成大药，伏制炮砂神妙全。 通顶龙芽　谷精草 如雪荒田不种多，丛丛簇簇若池荷。 贤士见时如珍宝，朱砂一点色如鹅。 地骨龙芽　枸杞 子若丹砂叶似云，冬根春夏叶华成。 秋时采取红娘子，制服丹砂色似银。 地丁龙芽　车前子 地丁长叶不生根，住处偏宜独一茎。 伏制水银成至宝，丹人岂识立神通。 木耳龙芽　佛耳草 木上生时状耳同，人看不识岂无功。 能变八石为大药，雄黄一点色金容。 地盘龙芽　荷叶 粉霜变化点成银，团团浮水色青青。 为见常人不止住，伏制毗霜有大灵。 万丈龙芽　松萝 数条万丈挂高松，张蔓开花交淡浓。 伏制丹砂成大药，鸡鸦化作凤凰形。

Berries like cinnabar, leaves like clouds,
Winter roots, spring-summer blooms.
Harvest in autumn’s red maiden,
Refining cinnabar to silver’s gleam.

**Earth Nail Dragon Sprout (Plantain Seed)**
Long leaves without roots, a single stem,
Its dwelling suits it alone.
It subdues mercury into supreme treasure,
Alchemists wield its divine power.

**Wood Ear Dragon Sprout (Mullein)**
Growing on wood like ears,
Unrecognized by mortals, yet potent.
It transforms the Eight Stones to medicine,
A touch of realgar turns it gold.

**Earth Tray Dragon Sprout (Lotus Leaf)**
Powdered frost transmutes to silver,
Round on water, verdant hue.
Though common folk pass it by,
It subdues *pi* frost with great efficacy.

**Ten-Thousand-Fathom Dragon Sprout (Usnea)**
Countless strands, ten thousand fathoms long,
Draped on lofty pines, blossoms pale and deep.
It subdues cinnabar to great medicine,
Transforming crows and chickens to phoenixes.

**Purple Blossom Dragon Sprout (Thistle)**
Purple blooms, green stems stretch o’er barren fields,
Roots and leaves gathered whole, their age unknown.
Harvested in mid-summer, dried in sun’s fierce gaze,
It subdues *pi* mercury, never to return.

**Fragrant Wood Dragon Sprout (Aloeswood)**
Deep gardens, secluded courts bear ever-springing boughs,
Roots and leaves best gathered in early summer’s grace.
It tames *pi* frost to pure white snow,
Turning copper to iron—beyond mortal thought.

**Golden Medicine Dragon Sprout (Chrysanthemum)**
Wondrous roots, stalks bloom with flowers rare,
Till the Double Ninth unfurls its finest blooms.
It subdues sulfur to treasure bright,
Consumed, it banishes illness, roots and all.

**Black Ascension Dragon Sprout (Indigo)**
High peaks, steep ridges nurture its verdant shoots,
Only the wise know its lofty branches’ worth.
It tames cinnabar to mirror-like sheen,
Its embryonic hue unchanging, flawless.

**Round-Leaf Dragon Sprout (Epimedium)**
Round, delicate leaves carpet verdant hills,
Summer’s heat dries them for alchemical use.
It binds realgar to golden hue,
Ninefold refined, it forges the Great Elixir.

**Fragrant Root Dragon Sprout (Cyperus)**
Roots called "green attachment," fragrant and fine,
By brooks and streams, its abundance grows.
Trust it to subdue *pi* into liquid gold,
Consumed, it transforms life into immortal streams.

**Mercury Sand Dragon Sprout (Jack-in-the-Pulpit)**
Spikes like onion blooms, first flushed with red,
Roots and leaves gathered for their potent might.
It subdues realgar to mighty medicine,
Transmuting dead iron to stubborn bronze.

**Strange Blossom Dragon Sprout (Peony)**
Late spring, near Grain Rain, buds unfold,
Flowers and leaves plucked with roots as one.
Powdered frost melts to silver’s flow—
No fear of error in its wondrous touch.

**Dragon Treasure Dragon Sprout (Tree Peony)**
With Grain Rain’s arrival, crimson buds swell,
Mixed hues dazzle, peerless in splendor.
It refines powdered frost to radiant light,
Those who master it ascend to immortals’ halls.

**Evergreen Dragon Sprout (Pine)**
On perilous peaks, its branches rise,
Leaves like green phoenix tails align.
It subdues mercury for transmutation’s art,
Through ages unending, sages’ wisdom shines.

**Side-Facing Dragon Sprout (Sumac)**
Yin Mountain’s streams bear myriad blooms,
Amid ten thousand leaves, its fame endures.
Evergreen, its heart bears fruit,
It tames *pi* frost to gleaming silver.

**Golden Blossom Dragon Sprout (Mallow)**
Spring’s warmth nurtures its fragrant growth,
As stems lengthen, golden blooms appear.
Its alchemical work grants divine power,
A treasure cherished in immortals’ abodes.

**Purple Gold Dragon Sprout (Camphor)**
Purple roots, white leaves by trees take root,
The enlightened prepare it for sacred arts.
It restrains the volatile, anchors metal and stone,
A touch of sulfur and it yields in submission.

**Earth Gall Dragon Sprout (Dodder)**
Purple flowers, green leaves thrive in fields,
It subdues arsenic powder, merging with sulfur’s spirit.

**Tie-Silk Dragon Sprout (Goat’s Horn Herb)**

**Disputing Earth Dragon Sprout (Single-Stemmed Grass)**

chunks.original_text: 不栽不种自然生，舍中宅畔倚长亭。 能交日月为大药，伏住朱砂独有灵。 道生龙芽　地编竹 叶钿华红长道边，行人岂认药中仙。 能制毗霜化为汁，一点顽铜软似绵。 仙衣龙芽　松萝 高挂松萝分外长，卫人深山采得将。 能伏飞走金石药，水银伏住死硫黄。 赤爪龙芽　波菜 能当大热拒严霜，却被风流烈此伤。 毗霜伏住如同玉，神仙采取入丹房。 仙掌龙芽　苍蓬　金勾　酸枣 长在寒池出洞傍，孟夏肥浓采作霜。 伏住硫黄人不会，服之发黑改衰苍。 银发龙芽　葱 根生似蒜鬓发长，伏毗一点不飞扬。 人间不会神仙药，伏制毗霜死粉霜。 仙力龙芽　韭 伏得丹阳状若银，通神仙骨贵相逢。 劝君莫向人问说，叶成偏医骨瘦人。 长生龙芽　奈冻 四时不华旺草华，绿水池边长嫩芽。 伏住硫黄真似玉，点铜化铁贵堪夸。 三黄龙芽　地黄 溪边野地立中身，识破三黄妙通神。 伏住硫黄精英在，拒火不能欲药灵。 缠树龙芽　凌霄 龙芽凌霄有宿根，远树张萝夏方成。 七月采得为药宝，汞精一点变白银。 舍生龙芽　瓦松 不在地上不居山，长在屋舍瓦珑问。 术人采得炉中用，水银一点自然乾。 耐冻龙芽　夏枯草 稠叶节节紫白华，春生荣旺夏枯查。 收得作汁通神妙，汞精一点变乾砂。 桑笑龙芽　桑叶并条 初春科斫尽成灰，淋汁熬霜立望基。 硫黄大通红焰起，一点低头汞不飞。 中央龙芽　黄草 龙芽为末桑问希，甘埚烧红裹烬之。 合在平地黑制过，水银滚沸汞不飞。 玄球龙芽　茄子 华间成结状如球，伏住硫黄甚更幽。 点化顽铜如白雪，万年不可与凡流。 香炉龙芽　紫苏 黄华绿叶长陂池，伏住硫黄八石痿。 神仙留下此般法，凡人难会卒难医。 青龙龙芽　葛根蔓 春生引蔓长龙头，曲曲盘盘到处游。 解使八石为大药，亦能伴汞自然稠。 地参龙芽　知母 知母贝母与南星，捣罗为末醋拌匀。 草母团砂金鼎内，三斤火毁化为银。 紫背龙芽　油点叶 蛇麻紫叶人间少，李瘦华红叶带班。 朱砂见时皆自死，水银伏了便枯乾。 天焰龙芽　莲华 长生根叶在水中，华如火焰叶背红。 六月采时堪供养，更能伏汞变成银。 存性歌 凡烧龙芽制其姻，姻去精华力便坚。 慢火五斤难擒制，却道仙家法不玄。 辩真 收采龙芽要及时，真是依法永不亏。 根叶茎实各使用，使用差错有疏危。 有绿 七十二般龙芽草，依时采折为家宝。 解将假物变成真，天赐衣禄济贫道。 纯阳吕真人药石制竟
chunks.translated_text:
**Dao-Generated Dragon Sprout (Ground Bamboo)**
Unplanted, unsown, it grows of itself,
By dwellings and pavilions it leans.
It binds sun and moon to forge the great elixir,
Subduing cinnabar with singular potency.

**Immortal’s Robe Dragon Sprout (Usnea)**
High-hung usnea sways in length,
Gathered by hermits from deep mountains.
It tames volatile essences, stills metal and stone,
Mercury yields, dead sulfur obeys.

**Crimson Claw Dragon Sprout (Spinach)**
It endures fierce heat, defies bitter frost,
Yet falls to the ravages of wanton winds.
*Pi* frost subdued, it gleams like jade,
Immortals gather it for the alchemical chamber.

**Immortal’s Palm Dragon Sprout (Reedmace / Golden Hook / Wild Jujube)**
By cold pools, near cave mouths it thrives,
In early summer, lush and rich, it yields its frost.
Sulfur bound, none comprehend its power—
Consumed, it darkens hair, restores youth’s hue.

**Silver-Hair Dragon Sprout (Scallion)**
Roots like garlic, leaves like locks,
A touch of *pi* and it ceases to fly.
Mortals know not this immortal’s drug,
It masters *pi* frost, stills powdered arsenic.

**Immortal’s Strength Dragon Sprout (Chinese Leek)**
It subdues cinnabar, silvery as refined silver,
Refining immortal bones for noble encounters.
I urge you: speak not of it to others,
Its leaves alone heal the emaciated.

**Longevity Dragon Sprout (Wintergreen)**
Through four seasons, though grasses bloom,
By green pools its tender shoots endure.
Sulfur bound, it gleams like true jade,
Transmuting copper, softening iron—worthy of praise.

**Three-Yellow Dragon Sprout (Rehmannia)**
By streams and wildlands it stands,
Its three yellows discerned, its wonders divine.
Sulfur bound, its essence preserved,
Fire repelled, its medicinal power awakens.

**Tree-Entwining Dragon Sprout (Chinese Trumpet Creeper)**
Dragon sprouts with ancient roots,
Far-reaching vines cling to trees, summer’s gift.
Gathered in the seventh month, a treasure,
A touch of mercury essence turns it to silver.

**House-Born Dragon Sprout (Moss on Roof Tiles)**
Neither earth nor mountain its home,
It grows on rooftops, among tiles.
Alchemists gather it for the crucible—
A touch of mercury and it dries naturally.

**Frost-Enduring Dragon Sprout (Selfheal)**
Dense leaves, jointed stems, purple-white blooms,
Spring’s vigor fades by summer’s end.
Its juice, divinely wrought, holds wondrous power,
A touch of mercury essence turns it to dry sand.

**Mulberry-Laugh Dragon Sprout (Mulberry Leaves and Twigs)**
Early spring’s prunings burned to ash,
Its lye boiled to frost, the base prepared.
Sulfur’s great passage ignites crimson flames—
A touch, and mercury bows, ceasing to fly.

**Central Dragon Sprout (Yellow Grass)**
Dragon sprouts ground to powder, mulberry’s query,
In a sweet crucible, red-hot, it is wrapped.
Buried in earth, blackened and refined,
Mercury seethes, yet ceases to flee.

**Mysterious Orb Dragon Sprout (Eggplant)**
Amidst blossoms, it forms like a sphere,
Sulfur bound, its depths profound.
Transmuting stubborn copper to snow-white,
Eternal, beyond the common stream.

**Incense Burner Dragon Sprout (Perilla)**
Yellow blooms, green leaves by ponds,
It subdues sulfur, stills the eight stones.
Immortals left this method behind—
Mortals scarcely grasp its swift cure.

**Green Dragon Dragon Sprout (Kudzu Vine)**
Spring-born, vines stretch like dragon heads,
Winding, coiling, roaming far.
It resolves the eight stones into the great elixir,
And naturally thickens mercury’s flow.

**Earth Ginseng Dragon Sprout (Anemarrhena)**
Anemarrhena, fritillaria, and jack-in-the-pulpit,
Pounded to powder, mixed with vinegar.
The herbal mother forms pellets in the golden crucible—
Three pounds of fire refine them into silver.

**Purple-Backed Dragon Sprout (Oil-Spot Leaf)**
Hops’ purple leaves, rare among men,
Plum’s slender blooms, speckled leaves.
Cinnabar meets it and dies,
Mercury subdued, it withers dry.

**Heavenly Flame Dragon Sprout (Lotus)**
Root and leaf abide in water,
Blossoms like flames, leaves crimson beneath.
Gathered in the sixth month for offerings,
It too can bind mercury, turning it to silver.

**Preserving Nature Song**
When burning dragon sprouts to temper their smoke,
Smoke gone, essence firm, its power endures.
Five pounds of slow fire are hard to control—
Yet the immortals’ method is no mystery.

**Discerning the True**
Gather dragon sprouts in their season,
True and lawful, they never fail.
Root, leaf, stem, fruit—each has its use,
Misused, danger and error arise.

**The Verdant**
Seventy-two kinds of dragon-sprout herbs,
Timely gathered, they become a household treasure.
They turn the false to true,
Heaven grants robes and sustenance to the poor Daoist.

**The Alchemical Refinements of Pure Yang Lü True Man—Concluded.**
